en_title: Government appoints members to Advisory Committee on Promotion of Arbitration
zh_title: 政府委任仲裁推廣諮詢委員會成員

en: The Department of Justice (DoJ) today (March 27) announced that members have been appointed to a new term of three years of the Advisory Committee on Promotion of Arbitration.
The Committee, chaired by the Secretary for Justice, includes representatives from the DoJ and members of the legal, arbitration and relevant sectors in Hong Kong.
The Committee advises and assists the DoJ in respect of the promotion of arbitration in Hong Kong, including but not limited to:

(a) considering, advising on and co-ordinating ongoing and new initiatives and overall strategies for the promotion of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region (HKSAR)'s arbitration services in and outside Hong Kong;

(b) serving as a forum for discussing such issues as may be raised by the legal and dispute resolution sectors concerning the promotion of the HKSAR as a leading centre for arbitration services in the Asia-Pacific region; and
(c) such matters as may be incidental to the matters stated in (a) and (b) above (including, but not limited to, the conduct of research or studies relating to arbitration).
The membership of the Committee is as follows:
Ms Teresa Cheng, SC, Secretary for Justice (Chairperson)
zh: 律政司今日（三月二十七日）宣布委任新一屆仲裁推廣諮詢委員會成員，任期三年。
該委員會由律政司司長擔任主席，成員包括律政司、法律、仲裁及相關界別的代表。
委員會就推廣香港的仲裁服務向律政司提供意見和協助，職權範圍包括但不限於：
（一）考慮、建議和協調在香港或境外推廣香港特別行政區仲裁服務的現行和新措施，及整體策略；
（二）作為平台討論法律及解決爭議界別提出有關推廣香港特別行政區作為亞太區主要仲裁服務中心等事項；以及
（三）上述（一）及（二）所引起的其他事宜（包括但不限於進行有關仲裁的資料搜集或研究）。
律政司司長鄭若驊資深大律師（主席）
